pullRequest.body:
Adds a `MorphismProperty.stalkwise` constructor for morphism properties of schemes from a property of ring homomorphisms. Also adds API for reducing proofs of stability under base change to affine situations for properties local at the target.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9861495149/job/27230046619)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9861495149/job/27230046943)
Maybe `AffineTargetMorphismProperty.of` so that you can use `targetAffineLocally (.of P)`.
Like so? `targetAffineLocally (.of P)` this notation does not seem to work though.
I don't think these need to be in `MorphismProperty`.

Yes, I added this to hide the interaction with `of P` and `AffineTargetMorphismProperty` in `StableUnderAffineBaseChange.stableUnderBaseChange`, but I am happy to just assume `(of P).StableUnderBaseChange` in this lemma instead. What do you think?
I think it makes sense to use `(of P).StableUnderBaseChange` directly.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry/Morphisms): stalkwise constructor and more API
